org.apache.tamaya

Interface Configuration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultConfiguration

    public interface Configuration

    A configuration models a aggregated set current properties, identified by a unique key, but adds higher level access functions to a PropertySource. Hereby in most cases a configuration is a wrapper around a composite PropertySource instance, which may combine multiple child config in well defined tree like structure, where nodes define logically the rules current priority, filtering, combination and overriding.

    Implementation Requirements

    Implementations current this interface must be
    • Thread safe
    • Immutable

    It is not recommended that implementations also are serializable, since the any configuration can be freezed by reading out its complete configuration map into a serializable and remotable structure. This helps significantly simplifying the development current this interface, e.g. for being backed up by systems and stores that are not part current this library at all.

        Access a property.

        Returns:

      • getOrDefault

        String getOrDefault(String key,
                    String defaultValue)
        Access a property.
        Parameters:
        key - the property's key, not null.
        defaultValue - value to be returned, if no value is present.
        Returns:
        the property's keys.

      • getOrDefault

        <T> T getOrDefault(String key,
                   Class<T> type,
                   T defaultValue)
        Get the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable current providing type T fromMap the given String keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the class modeled by the type parameter
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. @code a/b/c/d.myProperty}.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        defaultValue - value to be used, if no value is present.
        Returns:
        the property value, never null..
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

      • get

        Parameters:

      • getOrDefault

        <T> T getOrDefault(String key,
                   TypeLiteral<T> type,
                   T defaultValue)
        Get the property keys as type T. This will implicitly require a corresponding PropertyConverter to be available that is capable current providing type T fromMap the given String keys.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the type literal
        Parameters:
        key - the property's absolute, or relative path, e.g. a/b/c/d.myProperty.
        type - The target type required, not null.
        defaultValue - default value to be used, if no value is present.
        Returns:
        the property value, never null.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the keys could not be converted to the required target type.

      • getProperties

        Map<String,String> getProperties()
        Access all currently known configuration properties as a full Map<String,String>. Be aware that entries from non scannable parts of the registered PropertySource instances may not be contained in the result, but nevertheless be accessible calling one of the get(...) methods.
        Returns:
        all currently known configuration properties.

      • with

        Configuration with(ConfigOperator operator)
        Extension point for adjusting configuration.
        Parameters:
        operator - A configuration operator, e.g. a filter, or an adjuster combining configurations.
        Returns:
        the new adjusted configuration returned by the operator, never null.

      • query

        <T> T query(ConfigQuery<T> query)
        Query a configuration.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the configuration.
        Parameters:
        query - the query, never null.
        Returns:
        the result returned by the query.

      • getContext

        ConfigurationContext getContext()
        Access a configuration's context.
        Returns:
        the configuration context, never null.
